sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

body.p: After six years of faithful services as president of the Recreation Society, Mrs. Minna Vehsted declined the honor of being re-elected. An announcement to the same effect was also made by Mrs. Luise Kalb, the Vice-President of the organization. At yesterday's annual meeting held at the Bismark Garden, the choice of president fell upon Mrs. Luise Schrader, who has served the society as secretary for a number of years. The new vice-president is Mrs. Huttmann, the mother of H. W. Huttmann, a member of the School Board. The newly elected corresponding secretary is Mrs. Scholer. the second secretary is Mrs. Neiss; secretary of finances is Mrs. Werveke, and tre urer is Mrs. Scherr.

The departing president praised the sacrificial work of the members of the association, expressed her profound faith in people with humanitarian inclinations, [and asked] for the continuance of their assistance to this benevolent society.....
The cash register, inclusive of the invested capital, shows a surplus of $3,714.12.

Mrs. Vehstedt received considerable acclaim in appreciation of her work, during the dinner, which followed the meeting. Mr. Johann W. Dietz, the honorary guest of the evening, addressed the departing president with a poetical salutation. He also had the honor to present her with a cameo brooch and a bouquet of flowers, in the name of the members of the society, in acknowledgment of her work....Several new members joined the organization.
